As bad for my blood pressure as cigarettes and just as addictive.

Newest update is SO bad that everyone left due to hitboxes despite the fact there is no hitbox issue, just a desync, so the only people left are beyond sweat lords.

For killers, initially it is horribly unbalanced play. You're first 10 games will contain players of relatively equal skill. Hours 10-100 expect to either get your shit pushed in by players who are at LEAST 1/2 the entire rank system higher than you in skill level, or utterly stomp new players, only 1/20 matches will find that inbetween of balance. Also they almost all run the same 3 perks, so google: dead hard, borrowed time, and decisive strike before you play. Early game is 4/10 for killer, once you get the hang of it it becomes a 7/10.

Easy to medium difficulty games for survivors early on, just run the same 3 perks mentioned (requires you to buy DLC) and you're games will be significantly easier. Practice cutting corners, looping, and doubling back. 8/10 for survivor, hope you like sitting and watching your rank "4" friend play as you'll likely die within the first 3ish minutes and have to watch them play the other 7-15 minutes without you.

Also take the advice of other negative reviews with thousands of hours. Still semi fun though, would not be so bad if matchmaking had a semblance of balance, not recomended as 75% of the time you're new will not be fun. The game is fun to meh at the moment, but the toxicity of the community is honestly what causes this game to have a negative review for me.

As much as I hate to do this, I do recommend this game.

It's messy, painful, and oftentimes depressing. 
However, the developers do care about their game--they take pride in their work.
This means that contrary to many complaints, this game gets a lot of work--design, mechanics, the works. The problems come in the developers' inability to properly communicate with their community without pissing them off and the community's tendency to be pissy at everything they find slightly inconvenient.
It's genuinely fun so long as the people you're playing with are the same skill level.

...Also, it's the only game where you can play Amanda Young, as far as I'm aware. Bonus?

ok i am playing dbd almost from when it came out and i can tell you that they still haven't fixed those hitboxes which leads the game to unplayable....i bought many dlc's for this game cause i was hyped and i really like it at the beggining but there are still a lot of things to fix
1)Hitboxes---->in their setup there is an "attack cone" in front of the killer, if you're in that range you get hit, no matter what, and that is simply illogical
2)The rank system----->the game's ranking system is really bad cause  you can easily go up to rank 1 and still enter with teams/teammates who really doesnt know how to play against killers and be good so that means that if you get hooked you are 96% (4% to unhook yourself) based upon teammates and if they are not good trust me losing is pretty sure!

This game is actually really, really good and I think that it needs worked on a little bit but nothing huge. Sometimes I feel it's missing a little special something but nothing bad at all. Definitely would recommend this game for people that like and don't like to get scared and also for people who like teamwork or working with friends to escape a serial murderer. :)

This game suffers from a development team who simply doesn't understand their own game. Balancing decisions are made with little to no regard for the actual effectiveness of the abilities being nerfed/buffed, and power creep has rendered many of the game's launch roster obsolete as new killers and survivors are often effectively improvements over existing archetypes. In addition, the game's economy is completely unbalanced. There are some 40 odd characters added since the game's launch, each of which costs 9000 "shards" to buy. Earning that many "shards" takes nearly 100 hours of gameplay- I have only unlocked ONE character myself so far. These characters are $5 USD each otherwise, and buying a character actually makes your OTHER characters more powerful, as you can mix and match the traits they come with. In order to actually have all your options available be able to compete properly in this competitive, vs-mode-only game, you either need THOUSANDS of hours, or over a hundred dollars in DLC to do so. 

The game needs a complete and total overhaul, a sequel, or some other fresh start. It's marred in it's own issues and they are too deeply set to fix at this point, not that the developers are capable of listening to their customers' repeated and consistent concerns over the last several years. The gameplay can be fun when you get into a good groove, but more often than not one player missing a single QTE is enough to ruin an entire game for all parties involved, which is exacerbated by the godawful matchmaking- let alone the frustration caused by intentional greifing, which is rampant. DBD is a game that is annoying more often than entertaining, which sucks, because there's good buried in there. It's just not worth the effort to find most of the time.

Este juego es basura en su maxima expresión, lleno de bugs, killers toxicos, comunidad pesima, no pierdan su tiempo comprando esta basura, añado que el matchmaking esta inservible puedes ser ceniza IV recien compras el juego y te puede tocar contra un iridicente I, este juego sigue siendo mierda, no lo compren.

Killers are encouraged to camp, both through mechanics and through statements made by the developers. Survivors are punished for camping through a mechanic that flags your location.

That is just one single point that shows you how one-sided the "balancing" is.
In its current state, the game favors killers to such an insane extent that it isn't even funny. 

Playing survivor is impossibly difficult to a point where it isn't even a little bit fun. 

And playing killer is so easy it isn't even fun.

If its not fun, why bother?

Nach über 2000 Stunden Spielzeit wird es endlich einmal Zeit, eine Rezension und damit auch die Wahrheit über dieses Spiel zu schreiben. Am Anfang fand ich die Idee ziemlich cool. Die Umsetzung war auch recht gut gelungen. Jetzt nach einigen Jahren muss ich sagen, dass dieses Spiel die schlimmste Community besitzt, in der Geschichte der online Games! Das Spiel selber wird mit der Zeit immer schlechter. Die Entwickler kümmern sich relativ wenig um eine richtige faire Balance und um die Ausmerzung der Bugs, die inzwischen immer noch nicht behoben wurden. Die Intension der Entwickler liegt darin, noch mehr Killer zu modellieren, um noch mehr Geld zu verdienen. Das Spielprinzip zwischen Killer und Überlebender ist klar und deutlich. Aber dennoch ist die Balance zwischen Killer und Surv. ein absoluter WITZ! Teamplay war mal. Diese Zeiten sind definitiv vorbei! Wer hier in diesem Spiel erfolg haben möchte, sollte eine asoziale Schiene fahren und nur für SICH spielen. Sehr schade.. deinstallation erfolgreich abgeschlossen!
Simplemente genial.

Mas eu não vou parar de jogar, lol
